content: The "Connecting Rural America Act" aims to improve access to broadband telecommunications services in rural areas. The Rural Electrification Act of 1936 is amended to increase grants, loans, and grant amounts for rural areas, with priority given to poor and remote areas. Grant amounts under this section shall not exceed 50 percent of project development costs, with grant rates established based on factors like remote locations, low populations, and low income levels. The amended Rural Electrification Act prioritizes grants for poor and remote rural areas. Entities receiving assistance must submit quarterly reports on the use of funds and progress towards objectives. A searchable database of applicants and application status must be maintained online for public access. Entities receiving assistance under the amended Rural Electrification Act must provide detailed information, including the name of the entity, type of assistance, purpose of the assistance, and quarterly reports. Additional information to allow public monitoring of the assistance is also required. The Rural Electrification Act allows for deobligation of awards to grantees showing poor performance or fraudulent spending, with funds awarded competitively to new applicants. Additional reporting requirements are established for assistance recipients to ensure compliance. In subsection (j), amendments are made to include grants and remove references to loans. Mandatory funding of $20,000,000 for fiscal years 2013 through 2017 is allocated for grants, loans, and loan guarantees. Additional funds are made available until 2017.
